stanza.line: Why didst thou promise such a beauteous dayday
And make me travel forth without my cloakcloak
To let base clouds oertake me in my wayway
Hiding thy bravry in their rotten smokesmoke
Tis not enough that through the cloud thou breakbreak
To dry the rain on my storm-beaten faceface
For no man well of such a salve can speakspeak
That heals the wound and cures not the disgracedisgrace
Nor can thy shame give physic to my griefgrief
Though thou repent yet I have still the lossloss
Th offender sorrow lends but weak reliefrelief
To him that bears the strong offence crosscross
Ah but those tears are pearl which thy love shedssheds
And they are rich and ransom all ill deedsdeeds
